description: 3 letter country code
country name

Access to quality education (0=unequal; 4=equal) - Country experts' aggregated evaluation of the question, "To what extent is high quality basic education guaranteed to all, sufficient to enable them to exercise their basic rights as adult citizens?" measured on a scale of 0 to 4. Average for available years from 2011-2020

Primary school enrollment (% of children) - Total number of students of official primary school age who are enrolled in any level of education, expressed as a percentage of the total population of official primary school age. Average for available years from 2011-2020
Secondary school attainment (% of population) - Population with at least some secondary education (% ages 25 and older), Average for available years from 2011-2020

Quality weighted universities per million inhabitants - The number of universities in a country weighted by the quality of universities (SPI), Average for available years from 2011-2020, per million inhabitants (population from Penn World Table 9.1)
Citable documents - articles, reviews and conference papers - per 1,000 population, Average for available years from 2011-2020
ears of tertiary schooling - Number of years a person of tertiary school entrance age can expect to spend within tertiary education, Average for available years from 2011-2020
Expenditure-side real GDP at chained PPPs per Number of persons engaged (in 2011US$ per engaged person)
Expenditure-side real GDP at chained PPPs per hour worked, i.e., (Number of persons engaged x Average annual hours worked by persons engaged), in 2011US$ per hour worked
Expenditure-side real GDP at chained PPPs (in mil. 2011US$) per Number of persons engaged (in millions), Compound annual growth rate (CAGR) 2012-2017
World Bank region
Gini index (World Bank estimate) for the most recent year available

Binary: Countries to be considered for analyses: OECD members + non-OECD members ranked above rgdp/emp threshold (top 50), excluding oil dependent economies (criteria: OPEC membership and  oil rents according to WB data)
